text:
A fully working apache2 setup (Debian) fails to authenticate users if their password contains a section sign.

[Tue Oct 13 18:16:49 2009] [warn] [client 141.100.75.139] [15965] auth_ldap authenticate: user XXX authentication failed; URI /gosa/ [ldap_simple_bind_s() to check user credentials failed][Invalid credentials]

OpenLDAP is working and every other system (ssh, roundcube) allows login with just passwords.
creator: apache-bugs@jensthebrain.de

text: What's a section sign? What's the client, and is it UTF-8 encoded when it comes into Apache?
creator: covener@gmail.com

text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> What's a section sign? What's the client, and is it UTF-8 encoded when it comes
> into Apache?

A section sign is code 167 (decimal) in iso-8859-1.

This is likely the same issue as PR 45318. That PR has a proposed patch. Can you try it?
creator: sf@sfritsch.de
